TopicTitle: FTL Drive MK I (MKII Pictures inside)

Articles.Content: Gawd, I really want dat mk II hurray with it plox :3
Sorry, I had been working on some other projects and forgot to correct the code. I'll finish it ASAP guys !
Take your time, I have an essay to finish, then I will be able to do some work. Good to hear from you also
I wonder about a possible TARDIS-like drive, where you can I don't know, run the simulation backwards, or just jump to a point ahead, as well as move to a point in space, is that possible at all?
you should put this on kerbalnet

You really need to work on the textures so it actually looks like a part from KSP. At present they're very bland and crude, even a color matching would strongly improve their aesthetics. Great concept, and I encourage you to keep at it! I noticed you haven't updated in some time, may I suggest if you want more motivation modding that you message a few other modders and get in on a team project? There's quite a few going!

What would be very helpful is if someone was to texture it, as I am very crude when it comes to that.

The model itself I am thinking of scrapping and redoing, not sure at this point.

Nomad, I did this texture a few weeks ago and your welcome to it if you want it.

I only spent 15 minutes on it, so it's nothing special, but you could use it until you get something better.
Wow, that looks better then anything I could ever do However I was talking about the second version that me and Emilio are working on
Any idea when the Mk II will be up?

Sorry for not finishing the code... It should be fixed this weekend.

Here's a little preview of what the code currently does :

Once in orbit, you'll have to point your ship toward the right direction and engage SAS. Then press O. You will get a huge boost of speed. The engine will stay active for 10 seconds, then it will stop. You can only use the engine 5 times, after that it will deactivate. I'm currently working on an "ABORT" button : if you press "O" again while boosting, it will cut-off the engine. I'm also thinking about custom sounds, ways for recharging the engine....

Interesting, I suppose because of limited jumps you will have to have them dock-able. Good thing we have two mods that replicate docking

I have linux multimedia studio so let me see what I can come up with.
Is there any sort of plans where[game engine allowing, of course] you can 'jump' to any of the planets' SoI's?
if you want i could always work on a texture for it

I got bored today, and since the model was sitting at 904 polygons, I decided to reduce it by remaking everything.

Currently sits at 425 ish polygons, textured, unnoded but ready to go. Oh and it has a AO map in it so I should probably slap that on here as well.

To be honest, the texture on this is mediocre, here is a plain looking one if you want to do better.

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/16349584/basetexture.png

I included the base texture, so if you want, make a texture and I will try to get it in the release.
I love this mod, non of my rockets feel the same with out it. It's a bit Over Powered but thats not a bad thing in some cases. +1000000xtrillion.

For starters, use the Battery as the only fuel tank. It eats fuel like no tomorrow. Otherwise, it's your standard engine , 'cept the thrust , with is magnified exponentially.
